isis.stitle: 7.3 Liter Diesel Engine Service (1991) - INJECTION PUMP, NOZZLES, FUEL FILTER, SUPPLY PUMP AND GLOW PLUGS - FUEL INJECTION NOZZLES - DISASSEMBLY

svcproc.title: DISASSEMBLY

note.para: Disassemble only those nozzle holder assemblies that fail to meet specifications.

caution.para: WHEN MORE THAN ONE FUEL INJECTION NOZZLE HOLDER IS DISASSEMBLED, KEEP PARTS OF EACH SEPARATE, THE NOZZLE VALVE AND NOZZLE VALVE BODY ARE MATED PARTS AND MUST BE KEPT TOGETHER; IF REPLACEMENT OF EITHER PART IS NECESSARY, A NOZZLE TIP ASSEMBLY MUST BE ORDERED. NEVER INTERCHANGE THE NOZZLE VALVES AND NOZZLE VALVE BODIES.

svcproc.para: Disassemble the nozzle holder assembly for cleaning, inspection and service as follows:

step1.para: Wash all external dirt, grease and carbon deposits from holder assembly with suitable cleaning agent.
Remove copper seal washer from nozzle, if not removed earlier. (Discard old copper seal washer.)
A brass wire hand brush should be used to remove hardened deposits of dirt or carbon.

important.para: SOAK NOZZLE HOLDER ASSEMBLY IN A CARBON REMOVING CLEANING AGENT ("GUNK", "BENDIX CLEANER" OR EQUIVALENT) FOR AT LEAST 4 HOURS BEFORE REMOVING NOZZLE CAP NUT; OTHERWISE, THE NOZZLE LOCATING PINS MAY BE DAMAGED.

step1.para: Injection nozzle and holder assembly should be clamped down and attached to a workbench to prevent it from moving during disassembly.
Using a 19/32 in.12 point box wrench, loosen nozzle cap nut. Loosen until cap nut can be turned by hand.

note.para: A sharp blow to end of wrench may be required to break carbon bond between nozzle and cap nut.

step1.para: Remove cap nut, nozzle spacer (with dowels) (+) and nozzle tip from holder body.
Remove spring seat, spring and shims from holder body. (See Figure 9.47) Take care not to lose spacers (+).
